H0.text: Shedding a lot of fur is the most likely result for deer when a winter storm kills many of the plants they eat.

H1.text: Traveling in a herd is what deer will most likely do when a winter storm kills many of the plants they eat.

H2.text: Becoming thin is the most likely outcome for deer when a winter storm kills many of the plants they eat.

H3.text: Feeding on meat is what deer will do when a winter storm kills many of the plants they eat.

A4.text: Though almost entirely herbivorous, white-tailed deer have been known to opportunistically feed on nesting songbirds, field mice, and birds trapped in mist nets, if the need arises.
